title: How to Make Homemade Pumpkin Pie Poptarts

steps.headline: Stir the sugar, salt, and all-purpose flour in a medium-sized bowl.
steps.description: Use a metal whisk or wooden spoon to mix dry ingredients well. Use circle motions to blend everything together.

steps.headline: Add the cold butter and mash with a pastry cutter or with your hands.
steps.description: The pastry dough must be nice and doughy. If needed, try using a food processor to blend even better. Have it blend until very moist.

steps.headline: Knead dough.
steps.description: Dust your cooking space with extra leftover flour. Start kneading the dough until it forms and turns like real pastry dough.

steps.headline: Set dough aside and refrigerate.
steps.description: Split the pastry dough into two pieces and place them in a large bowl. Cover it with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Have it chill in the fridge for about half an hour, as chilled dough is easier to bake with. While dough is chilling, move on to part two on how to make the pumpkin filling.

steps.headline: Heat puree and spices in a frying pan or pot.
steps.description: Lay out a frying pan or pot on your stove and place your stove top on to medium heat. This will help bring flavor into your pumpkin filling.

steps.headline: Add the rest of the ingredients.
steps.description: Remove filling from heat and shut stove off. Pour filling into 1-2 bowls and have it chill while you prepare pop tart dough.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.
Roll dough about 9x12 inches thick.
steps.description: Flour your cooking space area once again Use a rolling pin to stretch pastry dough out. Use a pizza cutter to start cutting out rectangles everywhere around the dough.

steps.headline: Brush egg water on each rectangle.
steps.description: Wet your pastry brush or fork with egg water and start spreading it on each rectangular pop tart.

steps.headline: Close your pop tarts.
steps.description: Take out your pumpkin filling and lay out a tablespoon on a piece of dough. Close with it another rectangular piece. Fork the sides to help the tart close in. Repeat until there is no more dough.

steps.headline: Chill tarts really quick.
steps.description: Place them in the fridge to chill for about ten minutes.

steps.headline: Bake pop tarts.
steps.description: Set them on a greased, large tray and lay them there aside. Place them in the oven and have them bake for thirty minutes or until edges are starting to turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Have them cool.
steps.description: Remove tarts from oven and leave them on a dish to cool off. While you wait, make the maple glaze in part four of this article.

parts.name: Making the Maple Glaze and Serving

steps.headline: Stir all ingredients for maple glaze in a small bowl.
steps.description: You may use a whisk, a spoon, or a fork. Keep beating until the glaze starts to form.

steps.headline: Spread.
steps.description: Use a fork or pastry brush to dip the maple glaze on top of pop tarts.

text: Making the Pastry Stir the sugar, salt, and all-purpose flour in a medium-sized bowl. Use a metal whisk or wooden spoon to mix dry ingredients well. Use circle motions to blend everything together. Add the cold butter and mash with a pastry cutter or with your hands. The pastry dough must be nice and doughy. If needed, try using a food processor to blend even better. Have it blend until very moist. Knead dough. Dust your cooking space with extra leftover flour. Start kneading the dough until it forms and turns like real pastry dough. Set dough aside and refrigerate. Split the pastry dough into two pieces and place them in a large bowl. Cover it with plastic wrap or aluminum foil. Have it chill in the fridge for about half an hour, as chilled dough is easier to bake with. While dough is chilling, move on to part two on how to make the pumpkin filling. Making the Filling Heat puree and spices in a frying pan or pot. Lay out a frying pan or pot on your stove and place your stove top on to medium heat. This will help bring flavor into your pumpkin filling. Add the rest of the ingredients. Remove filling from heat and shut stove off. Pour filling into 1-2 bowls and have it chill while you prepare pop tart dough. Baking Pop Tarts Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.  Roll dough about 9x12 inches thick. Flour your cooking space area once again Use a rolling pin to stretch pastry dough out. Use a pizza cutter to start cutting out rectangles everywhere around the dough. Brush egg water on each rectangle. Wet your pastry brush or fork with egg water and start spreading it on each rectangular pop tart. Close your pop tarts. Take out your pumpkin filling and lay out a tablespoon on a piece of dough. Close with it another rectangular piece. Fork the sides to help the tart close in. Repeat until there is no more dough. Chill tarts really quick. Place them in the fridge to chill for about ten minutes. Bake pop tarts. Set them on a greased, large tray and lay them there aside. Place them in the oven and have them bake for thirty minutes or until edges are starting to turn golden brown. Have them cool. Remove tarts from oven and leave them on a dish to cool off. While you wait, make the maple glaze in part four of this article. Making the Maple Glaze and Serving Stir all ingredients for maple glaze in a small bowl. You may use a whisk, a spoon, or a fork. Keep beating until the glaze starts to form. Spread. Use a fork or pastry brush to dip the maple glaze on top of pop tarts. Enjoy!
